title: Mabuwaya Foundation
video.text.heading: Mabuwaya Foundation nagana yarn?
video.text.paragraph: The Mabuwaya Foundation aims to conserve the Philippine crocodile, other endemic threatened species and their habitat in collaboration with local communities in northern Luzon, the Philippines.

infoSection.title: Protecting Biodiversity
infoSection.text: Our team is dedicated to preserving the biodiversity of Northern Luzon by working with local communities to protect the Philippine crocodile.
quickFacts.heading: QUICK FACTS ABOUT THE PHILIPPINE CROCODILE IN THE WILD
quickFacts.leftFacts.1: Its habitat includes freshwater rivers and lakes.
quickFacts.leftFacts.2: They can grow up to 3 meters long.
quickFacts.leftFacts.3: They primarily feed on fish, crabs, and small mammals.
quickFacts.rightFacts.0: Philippine crocodiles are known for their distinct greenish-brown skin.
quickFacts.rightFacts.2: Conservation efforts are ongoing in Northern Luzon.
quickFacts.rightFacts.3: They are one of the smallest crocodile species in the world.
whySave.title: WHY SAVE THE PHILIPPINE CROCODILE
whySave.paragraph: The fate of our eagles, the forests and our children’s future are inextricably linked. Saving the Philippine eagle means protecting the next generation of Filipinos.
